title: Notes: IO/edge-case guarantees
description: IO/edge cases: extensions can be repeatable or comma-separated; include/exclude globs apply after extensions; respect-gitignore default only if .gitignore exists; no INPUT => empty context still valid; --output writes to file but JSON mode must remain valid JSON only; JSON mode should default verbose=false unless user forces --verbose; capture stray stdout via redirect_stdout and include in debug.captured_stdout; binary detection via NUL in first 8KB or heuristic.

title: Implement directory walking rules and limits
description:
Apply filters: extensions, include/exclude globs, respect .gitignore via pathspec, hidden/no-hidden, follow-symlinks, max-file-bytes, max-total-bytes.

Binary detection: skip or error; detect via NUL in first 8KB or heuristic.

Default excludes: .git/.hg/.svn, node_modules, __pycache__, .venv/venv, dist/build, optionally *.lock.

Warn/notice when total bytes limit reached.

title: Add gated integration test for rlm complete
description: Mark as @pytest.mark.integration and gate on RLM_CLI_INTEGRATION=1 and OPENAI_API_KEY.\n\nAssert non-empty response from rlm complete.

title: Notes: CLI surface area and options
description:
Commands: ask, complete, doctor, spec (--json), schema.

ask INPUT rules: dir path -> docs/files mode; file path -> doc; '-' stdin; raw text only with --literal. No input -> empty context.

Must-have options: question (required), backend (default openai), model (default empty), environment (default local), max-iterations (30), max-depth (1), verbose/quiet, config, json/output-format, output, log-dir, dir-mode docs/files, extensions, include/exclude, respect-gitignore, max-file-bytes (1_000_000), max-total-bytes (50_000_000), encoding (utf-8), binary skip|error, hidden, follow-symlinks, backend/env/rlm args, backend/env/rlm json.

Disambiguation: --literal, --path.

title: Implement rlm doctor checks (text + JSON)
description: Check Python version, rlm import/version, environment prerequisites (docker/modal/prime), and API key presence (OPENAI_API_KEY, ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, OPENROUTER_API_KEY).\n\nOutput checklist in text or checks[] JSON.

title: Create pyproject.toml with deps and console entrypoint
description: Phase 0: Create pyproject with deps (typer, pyyaml, pathspec, rich optional, rlm) and dev deps (pytest, ruff, mypy, types-PyYAML).\n\nAdd console script: rlm = rlm_cli.cli:app; add __main__.py for python -m rlm_cli.

title: Add self-documenting help content and examples
description: Expand --help with 1-line summary, 5-10 concrete examples (dir, file, stdin, json, config), and precedence rules (CLI > env > config > defaults).\n\nInclude golden examples and document exit codes and JSON schema version.

title: Implement RLM adapter invocation and response extraction
description:
Import RLM from rlm, call completion(prompt=context_payload, root_prompt=question).

Pass backend/environment/rlm kwargs with minimal hardcoding; support backend_kwargs model_name.

Extract response from completion.response if present else str(completion).

title: Doctor/spec/schema commands
description: Agent-facing doctor/spec/schema commands with JSON output.

title: Inputs & context payload
description: Parse inputs and build deterministic context payload from files/dirs/stdin.

title: Notes: Testing requirements and definition of done
description: Unit tests: dir loader, gitignore, json output, errors, help snapshots. Integration test gated by RLM_CLI_INTEGRATION and OPENAI_API_KEY.\n\nDoD: ask/complete/doctor run; JSON mode clean stdout; deterministic directory loading; help/examples; spec/schema; pytest+ruff+mypy pass; no noisy stdout in JSON mode.

title: Set up CI for lint/tests + optional upstream drift job
description: Add CI running pytest + ruff (+ mypy if configured).\n\nOptional nightly/weekly job: install rlm from GitHub main and run tests to catch drift.

title: RLM adapter & logging
description: Call upstream RLM safely, with optional logging and robust response extraction.

title: Scaffolding & package layout
description: Create project skeleton, dependencies, and module layout for rlm-cli v1.

title: Implement InputSource parsing (stdin/path/dir/literal)
description: Phase 3: Parse positional INPUT tokens into stdin (-), file path, dir path, or literal text (only if --literal).\n\nSupport --path to force path interpretation and error if missing.

title: Config system & precedence
description: YAML config loading, merge precedence, and passthrough arg parsing.

title: Notes: Architecture and module responsibilities
description:
Modules: inputs.py (parse INPUT tokens), context.py (build payload + summarize), config.py (load/merge/parse args), rlm_adapter.py (RLM call + logger), output.py (text/json render), errors.py (exceptions + render helpers), doctor.py, spec.py, schema.py, cli.py.

Repo layout: src/rlm_cli + tests/fixtures/tiny_repo, gitignore_repo; tests for ask/complete/dir/gitignore/json/errors/help.

RLM call: RLM(...); completion = rlm.completion(prompt=context_payload, root_prompt=question).

title: Notes: Output schema, exit codes, error style
description:
JSON output schema rlm-cli.output.v1 with fields: schema, ok, exit_code, result.response, request{question,inputs,backend,model,environment,limits}, artifacts{log_dir,rlm_log_files}, stats{documents,bytes_total,duration_ms}, warnings[].

Error JSON: ok=false, exit_code, error{type,message,hint,try[]}.

Exit codes: 0 success, 2 usage, 10 input, 11 config, 20 backend/auth, 30 runtime.

Text error format includes: what/why/how-to-fix/try-this.

title: Define error classes, exit codes, and self-documenting errors
description: Error types: CliUsageError (2), InputError (10), ConfigError (11), BackendError (20), RuntimeError (30).\n\nText errors include what/why/how-to-fix/try-this. JSON errors include type/message/hint/try[].

title: Implement rlm complete command (no context)
description: Implement complete synopsis: rlm complete TEXT [OPTIONS].\n\nUses prompt=""/{} and root_prompt=TEXT. Supports same model/env/output options as ask.

title: Notes: UX principles and agent-friendly IO
description:
Progressive disclosure: default short usage (rlm ask . -q "Where is the bug?" --json) and advanced tuning via --backend-arg/--env-arg/--rlm-arg and --*-json.

Self-documenting: help includes examples and precedence; errors include what/why/how-to-fix/try-this.

Agent-friendly IO: JSON mode -> stdout JSON only, logs to stderr; text mode -> answer to stdout, logs to stderr. Stable exit codes.

title: Testing & CI
description: Unit/integration tests and CI (including optional upstream drift checks).

title: Implement Typer app skeleton with commands and global flags
description: Phase 1: Typer app with commands: ask, complete, doctor, spec, schema.\n\nGlobal options: --version, --json (or per-command), and consistent help text.

title: CLI commands & UX
description: Implement Typer CLI commands, help UX, and flag surface for v1.

title: Build deterministic context payload (docs/files modes)
description:
Build context payload dict with type=rlm_cli_context_v1, root, documents[], notes.

Each document includes id, path (relative), language, bytes, sha256, content.

Stable ordering: path lexicographic (POSIX separators), then id.

title: Implement YAML config loading and precedence
description:
Phase 2: Load config from --config or default search: ./rlm.yaml, ./.rlm.yaml, ~/.config/rlm/config.yaml.

Precedence: CLI flags > env vars (at least output format + config path) > config > defaults.

Support optional --print-effective-config (text to stderr, JSON field in json mode).

title: Parse backend/env/rlm passthrough args and JSON merges
description: Parse --backend-arg/--env-arg/--rlm-arg KEY=VALUE (type coercion via bool/int/float/null/json).\n\nMerge --backend-json/--env-json/--rlm-json @file.json into kwargs.

title: Notes: Context payload format and directory rules
description:
Context payload: {type: rlm_cli_context_v1, root, documents[], notes{generated_by, extensions, excluded, respect_gitignore}}.

Document fields: id, path (relative), language, bytes, sha256, content.

Deterministic ordering: path lexicographic (POSIX), then id.

Directory rules: skip >max-file-bytes; stop after max-total-bytes with warning; binary detection via NUL/heuristic; respect .gitignore via pathspec by default; default excludes .git/.hg/.svn, node_modules, __pycache__, .venv/venv, dist/build, optionally *.lock.

dir-mode: docs (structured) vs files (raw strings).

title: Implement rlm spec --json with CLI contract
description: spec JSON includes CLI version, rlm version, commands/options/defaults, and output schema version.\n\nInclude inspect.signature(RLM.__init__) when available to stay current.

title: Output formats & error handling
description: JSON/text output, clean stdout, error schema, and exit codes.

title: Notes: Maintenance plan and golden examples
description: Compatibility: minimal hardcoding; passthrough args; spec includes RLM signature; CI optional drift job.\n\nGolden help examples: ask dir, ask file, stdin diff, complete JSON, power-user backend/env args.

title: Implement rlm schema output
description: Print JSON output schema (Draft 2020-12 or ad-hoc) used by rlm-cli.output.v1.

title: Create package/module layout and test fixtures
description: Phase 0: Create src/rlm_cli modules (cli.py, config.py, inputs.py, context.py, rlm_adapter.py, output.py, errors.py, doctor.py, spec.py, schema.py) and tests/fixtures structure.

title: Notes: Dependency strategy options (A/B)
description: Dependency strategy: Option A (recommended) normal dependency on rlm from PyPI/GitHub; Option B supported: git submodule vendor/rlm with editable install. Code should remain agnostic to which option is used.

title: Notes: Default extensions list
description: Default extensions for directory ingestion: .py,.ts,.js,.jsx,.tsx,.java,.go,.rs,.cpp,.c,.h,.md,.txt,.json,.yaml,.yml,.toml. Extensions apply before include/exclude globs.

title: Implement upstream compatibility strategy
description: Keep hardcoding minimal; rely on passthrough args (backend/env/rlm kwargs).\n\nEnsure spec reflects RLM.__init__ signature when available.

title: rlm-cli v1 implementation
description: Ship rlm-cli v1 per spec: ask/complete/doctor/spec/schema, JSON-first IO, deterministic context ingestion, and upstream-friendly integration.

title: Notes: Goals and scope (v1)
description:
Primary goal: CLI rlm that runs completion with context (string/file/stdin/dir), root question, configurable backend/model/env/iteration, output text or JSON.

Secondary goals: doctor/spec/schema commands and compatibility with upstream RLM params.

Out of scope v1: TUI chat, streaming tokens, remote URLs, embeddings/RAG, extra tool calling, cross-run caching (except trivial persistent REPL if upstream), multimodal inputs, shell completions.

title: Maintenance & compatibility
description: Keep rlm-cli compatible with upstream rlm via passthrough and introspection.

title: Notes: Build phases 0-7
description: Phase 0 scaffolding; Phase 1 CLI skeleton + spec/schema placeholders; Phase 2 config merge; Phase 3 directory ingestion; Phase 4 RLM invocation; Phase 5 output + errors; Phase 6 doctor + help quality; Phase 7 polish/tests/CI.

title: Implement JSON/text output rendering and clean stdout
description:
Output schema rlm-cli.output.v1 with required fields (schema, ok, exit_code, result, request, artifacts, stats, warnings).

In --json mode, stdout must be JSON only; capture accidental stdout and include in debug fields if needed.

Text mode prints only response to stdout, logs to stderr.

title: Notes: Config system and schema
description:
Config YAML keys: backend, model, environment, max_iterations, max_depth, backend_kwargs (model_name), environment_kwargs, other_backends, other_backend_kwargs, output.format/log_dir.

Precedence: CLI > env vars > config > defaults.

Config search: ./rlm.yaml, ./.rlm.yaml, ~/.config/rlm/config.yaml.

title: Implement rlm ask command options and behavior
description: Implement ask synopsis: rlm ask [INPUT ...] -q/--question TEXT [OPTIONS].\n\nMust-have options: backend, model, environment, max-iterations, max-depth, verbose/quiet, config, json/output-format, output, log-dir, dir-mode, extensions, include/exclude, respect-gitignore, max-file-bytes, max-total-bytes, encoding, binary, hidden, follow-symlinks, backend/env/rlm args, backend/env/rlm json files, literal/path disambiguation.

title: Add unit tests for directory loading, JSON output, errors, help
description: Required tests: dir loader (extensions, excludes, max bytes, ordering), gitignore respect, json output keys/clean stdout, error cases (missing question, missing path with --path), help snapshots (rlm, rlm ask, rlm doctor).\n\nAdd fixtures: tiny_repo, gitignore_repo.

title: Attach optional RLMLogger logging
description: Best-effort import and attach RLMLogger(log_dir=...) if available.\n\nOtherwise store CLI debug logs in log-dir.
